revised_title: The Effects of Quenching on the Elastic Properties of Metals
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the changes in elastic properties of metals, such as steel, iron, copper, and aluminum, when they are suddenly cooled or "quenched." They found that quenching from high temperatures causes a marked loss of elasticity in all metals, leading to increased brittleness and reduced ability to withstand stress. This research helps to understand the behavior of metals under different conditions and can be applied to improve their mechanical properties.
